version_description:
Added Azimuth and Altitude data to the initial quick glance view, and also to the single day view.
Cleaned up quick glance view for mainly iPads.
Fixed a few minor bugs, when selecting dates in the single day view.

This update adds support for iPhone X, XS, XS Max. Enabled the status bar.
The current and upcoming moon images on the initial, quick glance screen now indicate if there is an eclipse, super or micro moon on that day.
The same current and upcoming moon images now take you to the single day view for that moon.
Also had some minor UI updates, and a bug fix.

Optimized memory usage in calendar view.
Added Today Widget.

Lunar Eclipse List and Detail View. You no longer need to hunt the calendar for lunar eclipses.
Update to graphics on the notification center widget.
Added informational graphics to eclipse info pages.
Other minor interface graphic updates and glitch fixes.
New Icon.

Added current moon constellation to initial quick glance view, and single day view.
Tweaked display on single day view.

Update for iOS 13.
Crash fix for new installs on iOS 13.
Tweaked Icon and Launch Screen.
Fix for dark widget text on dark background for iOS 13 in light mode.

Hour slider in single day view, was being overridden by a page swipe.
Hour slider time in single day view was unreadably dark in dark mode.
Fix for dyslexic supermoon/micromoon description in informational panels.

Fix for some users seeing moon rise/set off by one hour.
Fix for initial view not updating after requesting notification and location permissions.

Minor glitch fixes.
Advertisement was overlapping home bar on iPad Pros.
Calendar day icon day text vanished in dark mode.
Solar eclipse map view detail was hard to read in dark mode.

Added Lunar Apsis ( Apogee and Perigee ) to Quick Glance, Calendar, and Single Days views.
Minor visual tweaks to calendar and single day views.

Added Blue Moon Indication on the Initial, Quick Glance View.
Tweaked interface to support recent changes in iOS.
Updated info pages.
Minor display tweaks for iPad users.
